revised_title: The Parasitic Nature of Nitragin and its Role in Leguminous Plant Nodules
tldr: The authors study the nodules found on the roots of leguminous plants and confirm their parasitic nature. They discover that the filaments within the nodules consist of straight rodlets, which transform into X, Y, and Y-shaped bacteroids. The authors also investigate the role of Nitragin in plant growth and infection, finding that it can increase yield in soils poor in nitrates.
